page.title: 10Housing in Solihull
page.content: In recent years{Solihull}has became a popular place to live. Therefore a great deal of land has been developed for{housing.}Certain parts of Solihull come under the higher income bracket, while at the same time there are several{council estates.}One or two traditional houses remain but most of the area is made up of fairly modern settlements such as Cheswick Green, Cranmore and the Widney/Monkspath {development.}All of these main housing areas were built within 15 years of each other;Cranmore is the oldest and Widney/Monkspath,the youngest,is still being developed. We talked to agents at some of the new show homes and found most people want traditionally built houses rather than timber framed. Ensuite and downstairs cloakrooms are very popular.
